official_title: A bill directing a study and report on requiring proper lighting of boat landing ramps adjacent to waters subject to the jurisdiction of the United States, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Requires the Corps of Engineers to study the feasibility of requiring all boat loading facilities subject to U.S. jurisdiction to display sufficient lighting from sunset to sunrise to make such facility's presence known within a reasonable distance. Directs that such study be reported with recommendations to the appropriate congressional committees by June 1, 1982.

titles.title: A bill directing a study and report on requiring proper lighting of boat landing ramps adjacent to waters subject to the jurisdiction of the United States, and for other purposes.
